poem:
### Epping Reverie

Sunlit murmurs, pints on High Street—  
truth stirred by shadows,  
dancing rumors tangled.  
  
Masked whispers veiled in certainty,  
police phantoms gliding through  
a crowd stitched with belief.  
  
Epping, where stories ferment  
like afternoon ales,  
brewed between what's seen  
and what imagination swells.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How violent protests in Epping are being fuelled by disinformation Enjoying beers in the afternoon sunshine on Epping High Street, the three local men were adamant about recent events in the town. Not only had Essex police used their own vans to “bus in” antiracism counter-demonstrators last week to Epping, said one of the men, but masked undercover police officers had been among the “lefties”. “They were masked up and looked like foot soldiers. Anyone". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
